Dear Dick:
I have your note of April 12th, and in accordance with
your request, I am forwarding whatever so-called printed
material we have on the NAEB Transcription Network.
Trying to keep a half-dozen Indian Clubs in the air at one
time is not an easy job. This thing has taken tremendous
resources in personnel and in money. I have virtually exÂ¬
hausted our telegram code in the current budget, just trying
to get some of our brethren to give us a fast and firm answer.
Mrs. Linder has been devoting almost all of her time trying
to keep this Network functioning.
Any arrangements we have made thus far have been for strictly
non-commercial purposes. While I appreciate your interest in
labor stations, so far as I know, such stations are selling
time, and the arrangements we have made thus far would hot be
applicable. Obviously, such stations could apply direct to
the originators of these programs for permission to use them.
Unfortunately, I do not have sufficient resources here to do
the joh.
